profile_positions.description:
Cristina Tanzi's scientific work began with thermonuclear fusion in the UK, followed by earth observation in the UV-range in the Netherlands and is presently on radiation protection. The focus is on regulatory purposes, alongside activities within the accident preparedness and response system of the Netherlands (emphasis on air dispersion modelling).

- Fukushima City 4 years after meltdown; ground truth,  CP Tanzi,
NTS, 7(3):22-29; 2016

- Monitoring of ambient dose equivalent at the boundary of nuclear sites to verify compliance with the regulations, 
CP Tanzi et al, Proc 14th IRPA, Cape Town,  pp 1404-1408, 2017
http://irpa.net/docs/IRPA14%20Proceedings%20Volume%204.pdf

- Environmental Monitoring in the Netherlands at RIVM, 
C Tanzi et al, Proc 4th IRPA, Geneva, 2014, PS5-4/16, pp 259-262

- A proof of the sum rule for point sources of external radiation as an upper estimate for exposure,
